name: Parador Villas del Mar Hau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed several nights in May. We stayed in an upper unit with a fantastic view and always a nice cross breeze with the balcony doors open.
reviews.title: Great place to Relax

reviews.text: The caves in the water made for great fun and adventure for both adults and children.
reviews.title: Great location, beach and restaurant. Villas and ownership needs a lot of work.

likes.disliked: — some of the older villas really need an upgrade

reviews.text: The beach was accessible in both directions for a nice long walk!
reviews.title: Great spot for our wedding
Get away from it all
reviews.text: We ate at the restaurant every night and enjoyed both the ambience and the food.
Our compliments to the chef--seafood dishes rated right along those of top restaurants we visited in San Juan for quality and presentation.
reviews.title: Wonderful low-key beach destination

likes.liked: — Gorgeous beachfront setting with amazing sunsets

reviews.title: Beautiful Location - Excellent Restaurant - Ready to Book a Week
reviews.text: I was originally not scheduled to stay at this hotel. I had booked 2 nights at Ocean Front ([--]) & after an uncomfortable (unbearable?) first night there I left. Thank god I remembered the name "Mar Hau" in the area & was able to book a villa at the last minute. This is not your average property, & that's a good thing. The hotel exhibits what is best in the Puerto Rican way of life -- relaxed, genial & proud. The restaurant is a certified "Meson Gastronomico" & has earned that certification. Fresh lobster & a bottle of rioja cost about 1/2 of what it would cost in the U.S. & was just as good. I would not hesitate to book a week there in the future. The surrounding area doesn't have much at all as far as attractions, but the Mar Hau property is the perfect place to relax.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as we entered Isabela and saw the view we knew this was the place for us. Once we entered the hotel grounds, it was like a tropical paradise. The hotel staff went out of their way for us. We were upgraded to our own personal cabin overlooking the lagoon.
reviews.title: Paradise Found

reviews.text: Our cabin was two bedrooms with a living area and kitchen. Very cozy. There is cable tv in the living area and a/c in the bedrooms. We really didn't need the a/c for our visit, just open the windows for the ocean breeze. Don't be afraid to ask staff for anything, they are very accomodating. Housekeeping even did our laundry so we wouldn't lose out on beach time!
reviews.title: I love it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Anne, who runs the horseback riding, was great! She took us out through the trails and gave us a full tour of the grounds.
reviews.title: A place to relax

likes.liked: — the location and the architecture of the cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are used to resort vacations, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for peace, quiet and relaxation, this is heaven.
reviews.title: Loved this location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I drove around the island and stayed at this property one night. I think a family would enjoy it. It's set up kind of like a camp. It is a gated property with casitas and condos that overlook the bay. There are horses, a small pool, a basketball court, a restaurant ( where we had the best food of our trip) and a small convenience store. The grounds are well-kept. Just understand that it is not a big, luxury resort. Each unit has a sitting area and one or two bedrooms and a small kitchen with full-sized fridge. The beach is coarser type sand with waves constantly coming in. You can snorkel a little but there's not alot to see. Walking the beach to the left, you come to the next cove, which is a nice public beach with another restaurant for burgers etc. We paid $140 for a king bed, sitting area and kitchen.
reviews.title: Good for family

likes.liked: — It was comfortable and economical, 45 minutes from San Juan

reviews.text: We were looking for something out of the way, non-resort hoopla with just a bed and a great view and we found it at this place. The room was just ok, basic needs, bed, tv, table and chairs. We've done the big all-inclusive resorts and they sure are nice, but if you are looking for peace and quiet with a fantastic beach and great views then this is the place. We definitely would have loved some better amenites (updated kitchen), but the service Christina provided and the wonderful beach made up for it. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great Times!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Villas del Mar Hau 3 or 4 years in a row, but have not been back to PR for 3 years. We were in for a shock.
reviews.title: Prices went up and quality went down.

likes.liked: — French doors to the great beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room they gave us for $124 had indoor/outdoor carpeting that was filthy, windows ditto, the whole room smelled moldy, or ? Spoke with another couple who had had a similar experience.
reviews.title: Loved the beach and Chef!!

reviews.text: We refused that room and got another with same window condition (looked like they hadn't been washed in the 3 years we weren't there). The draperies hadn't been opened in ages and were very dirty. But it did have a balcony view of beach, and a stove & frig.
reviews.title: Wedding group , International Travelers

likes.disliked: — Restaurant, dogs running wild, poor service from staff

reviews.text: Best place to unwind and recharge batteries. Contact with nature is awesome. Great ocean views, magnificent beach right in front of you. Just the right place for me,...I can't stop coming back whenever possible
reviews.title: For a ''take it all off'' experience: stress, anxiety, love breakdown, etc.

likes.disliked: — nothing bothersome except reality of having to leave

reviews.text: We had been planning our 4th family reunion and thought it would be great to do in our homeland of Puerto Rico. We started planning April of 05. When we contacted the hotel and informed them that we were having a family reunion (with at least 7 - 10 families in attendance) we requested a special rate and the answer was a resounding NO. That should have stopped us right there but we decided that because of the location and the beauty of the surroundings it would be worth whatever the cost.
reviews.title: Great View not so great service

reviews.text: We rented 9 homes in total (which by the way since we had booked so early we requested that we have as many of the houses one next to the other and they were not able to comply), There were over 40 family members and because we were given such a small time frame to book, several members could not make it . So, those members booked in area hotels and figured we could just go in and spend our time with our families even though we would have the inconvenience of having to travel back out again late in the evening. To our surprise, the first family that arrived wednesday night was told at the gate that they were not allowed to go in unless they were actually staying there. That our only solution was to call our family out to the parking lot to say hello.
reviews.title: loved it

likes.disliked: — some construction going on while we were there

reviews.text: Had we even known that this was to happen, we would have NEVER booked with them since what good is a family reunion if the rest of the family cannot be with you.
reviews.title: It is what it is.....

reviews.text: The next solution that they gave us was for our family members to pay $25.00 per day EACH person that wanted to come in for the day! Our reunion was from Wednesday thru Sunday!! After much discussion they were then "KIND" enough?! to lower the price to $10.00 per day.
reviews.title: Rustic lodging on a beautiful beach

aka: Parador Villas Del Mar Hau Hotel Isabela
description: Charming beachfront villas located on one of the most beautiful beaches of the northwest region of Puerto Rico. Our facilities include restaurant, tennis court, pool area, beach volleyball and also basketball court. Nearby Jobos beach and Middles ideal for practicing the sport of surfing. Also practice snorkeling or horseback riding in our facilities, the perfect place to unwind and have an unforgettable stay.
